trans-unit.source: Business-to-Business Connectors and API Apps in Microsoft Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Business-to-Business Connectors and API Apps in Microsoft Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create and configure EDI, EDIFACT, AS2, and TPM connectors; microservices architecture
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create and configure EDI, EDIFACT, AS2, and TPM connectors; microservices architecture

trans-unit.source: Business-to-Business Connectors and API Apps in Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Business-to-Business Connectors and API Apps in Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure App Service (or App Service for short) includes many BizTalk API Apps that are vital to integration environments.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure App Service (or App Service for short) includes many BizTalk API Apps that are vital to integration environments.

trans-unit.source: These API Apps are based on concepts and tools used within BizTalk Server, but are now available as part of Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: These API Apps are based on concepts and tools used within BizTalk Server, but are now available as part of Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: One category of these API Apps are the Business-to-Business (B2B) API Apps.
trans-unit.target: One category of these API Apps are the Business-to-Business (B2B) API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Using these B2B API Apps, you can easily add partners, create agreements, and do everything as you would on-premises using EDI, AS2, and EDIFACT.
trans-unit.target: Using these B2B API Apps, you can easily add partners, create agreements, and do everything as you would on-premises using EDI, AS2, and EDIFACT.

trans-unit.source: These B2B API Apps offer "Trigger" and "Action" capabilities.
trans-unit.target: These B2B API Apps offer "Trigger" and "Action" capabilities.

trans-unit.source: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of an X12 message from a partner.
trans-unit.target: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of an X12 message from a partner.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result, like after receiving an X12 message, then send the message using AS2.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result, like after receiving an X12 message, then send the message using AS2.

trans-unit.source: What is a Business-to-Business Connector or API Apps
trans-unit.target: What is a Business-to-Business Connector or API Apps

trans-unit.source: The Business-to-Business (B2B) feature includes existing, pre-built API Apps that allow different companies, divisions, applications, and so on to communicate using AS2, EDI, and EDIFACT.
trans-unit.target: The Business-to-Business (B2B) feature includes existing, pre-built API Apps that allow different companies, divisions, applications, and so on to communicate using AS2, EDI, and EDIFACT.

trans-unit.source: The B2B API Apps include:
trans-unit.target: The B2B API Apps include:

trans-unit.source: Connector or API Apps
trans-unit.target: Connector or API Apps

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Trading Partner Management
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Trading Partner Management

trans-unit.source: An API App that creates business-to-business (B2B) relationships using partners and agreements.
trans-unit.target: An API App that creates business-to-business (B2B) relationships using partners and agreements.

trans-unit.source: These relationships utilize the AS2, EDIFACT, and X12 protocol.
trans-unit.target: These relationships utilize the AS2, EDIFACT, and X12 protocol.

trans-unit.source: The TPM API App is the base requirement of the AS2 connector, and the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps.
trans-unit.target: The TPM API App is the base requirement of the AS2 connector, and the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Connector
trans-unit.target: AS2 Connector

trans-unit.source: A connector that receives and sends messages using the AS2 transport.
trans-unit.target: A connector that receives and sends messages using the AS2 transport.

trans-unit.source: The connector transports data securely and reliably over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: The connector transports data securely and reliably over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: BizTalk EDIFACT
trans-unit.target: BizTalk EDIFACT

trans-unit.source: An API App that receives and sends messages using EDIFACT.
trans-unit.target: An API App that receives and sends messages using EDIFACT.

trans-unit.source: EDIFACT is also commonly referred to as UN/EDIFACT (United Nations/Electronic Data Interchange For Administration, Commerce and Transport) and is widely used across industries.
trans-unit.target: EDIFACT is also commonly referred to as UN/EDIFACT (United Nations/Electronic Data Interchange For Administration, Commerce and Transport) and is widely used across industries.

trans-unit.source: BizTalk X12
trans-unit.target: BizTalk X12

trans-unit.source: An API App that receives and sends messages using the X12 protocol.
trans-unit.target: An API App that receives and sends messages using the X12 protocol.

trans-unit.source: X12 is also commonly referred to as ASC X12 (Accredited Standards Committee X12) and is widely used across industries.
trans-unit.target: X12 is also commonly referred to as ASC X12 (Accredited Standards Committee X12) and is widely used across industries.

trans-unit.source: Using these API Apps, you can complete different EDI messaging tasks.
trans-unit.target: Using these API Apps, you can complete different EDI messaging tasks.

trans-unit.source: For example, using the AS2 connector, you can securely receive and send different types of messages (EDI, XML, Flat-File, and so on) to a customer, a division within your company like Human Resources, or anyone that uses AS2.
trans-unit.target: For example, using the AS2 connector, you can securely receive and send different types of messages (EDI, XML, Flat-File, and so on) to a customer, a division within your company like Human Resources, or anyone that uses AS2.

trans-unit.source: You can create as many API Apps as you want and create them easily.
trans-unit.target: You can create as many API Apps as you want and create them easily.

trans-unit.source: You can also reuse a single API App within multiple scenarios or workflows.
trans-unit.target: You can also reuse a single API App within multiple scenarios or workflows.

trans-unit.source: You can do this without writing any code.
trans-unit.target: You can do this without writing any code.

trans-unit.source: Let's get started.
trans-unit.target: Let's get started.

trans-unit.source: Requirements to Get Started
trans-unit.target: Requirements to Get Started

trans-unit.source: When you create B2B API Apps, there are some required resources.
trans-unit.target: When you create B2B API Apps, there are some required resources.

trans-unit.source: These items must be created by you before they can be used within other API Apps.
trans-unit.target: These items must be created by you before they can be used within other API Apps.

trans-unit.source: These requirements include:
trans-unit.target: These requirements include:

trans-unit.source: Requirement
trans-unit.target: Requirement

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Stores B2B items including partners, schemas, certificates, and agreeements.
trans-unit.target: Stores B2B items including partners, schemas, certificates, and agreeements.

trans-unit.source: Each of the B2B API Apps requires its own Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Each of the B2B API Apps requires its own Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Copy the connection string to this database.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Copy the connection string to this database.

trans-unit.source: [Create an Azure SQL Database](../sql-database-get-started.md)
trans-unit.target: [Create an Azure SQL Database](../sql-database-get-started.md)

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage container
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage container

trans-unit.source: Stores message properties when AS2 archiving is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Stores message properties when AS2 archiving is enabled.

trans-unit.source: If you don't need AS2 message archiving, a Storage container is not needed.
trans-unit.target: If you don't need AS2 message archiving, a Storage container is not needed.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you are enabling archiving, copy the connection string to this Blob Storage.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you are enabling archiving, copy the connection string to this Blob Storage.

trans-unit.source: [About Azure Storage Accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md)
trans-unit.target: [About Azure Storage Accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md)

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Namespace and its Key values
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Namespace and its Key values

trans-unit.source: Stores X12 and EDIFACT batching data.
trans-unit.target: Stores X12 and EDIFACT batching data.

trans-unit.source: If you don't need batching, a Service Bus namespace is not needed.
trans-unit.target: If you don't need batching, a Service Bus namespace is not needed.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you are enabling batching, copy these values.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you are enabling batching, copy these values.

trans-unit.source: [Create a Service Bus Namespace](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh690931.aspx)
trans-unit.target: [Create a Service Bus Namespace](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh690931.aspx)

trans-unit.source: TPM Instance
trans-unit.target: TPM Instance

trans-unit.source: A BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM) instance is required to create an AS2 connector and X12 or EDIFACT API App.
trans-unit.target: A BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM) instance is required to create an AS2 connector and X12 or EDIFACT API App.

trans-unit.source: When you create the TPM API App, you are creating the TPM Instance.
trans-unit.target: When you create the TPM API App, you are creating the TPM Instance.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Know the name of your TPM API App.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Know the name of your TPM API App.

trans-unit.source: Create the API Apps
trans-unit.target: Create the API Apps

trans-unit.source: B2B API Apps can be created using the Azure portal or using REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: B2B API Apps can be created using the Azure portal or using REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: Create the API Apps using REST APIs
trans-unit.target: Create the API Apps using REST APIs

trans-unit.source: See the documentation on how to use the REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: See the documentation on how to use the REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: Create the B2B API Apps in the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Create the B2B API Apps in the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, you can create B2B API Apps when creating Logic Apps, Web Apps, or Mobile Apps.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, you can create B2B API Apps when creating Logic Apps, Web Apps, or Mobile Apps.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can create one using its own blade.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can create one using its own blade.

trans-unit.source: Both ways are easy so it depends on your needs or preferences.
trans-unit.target: Both ways are easy so it depends on your needs or preferences.

trans-unit.source: Some users prefer to create all the B2B API Apps with their specific properties first.
trans-unit.target: Some users prefer to create all the B2B API Apps with their specific properties first.

trans-unit.source: Then, create the Logic Apps/Web Apps/Mobile Apps, and add the B2B API Apps you created.
trans-unit.target: Then, create the Logic Apps/Web Apps/Mobile Apps, and add the B2B API Apps you created.

trans-unit.source: The following steps create the B2B API Apps using the API Apps blade.
trans-unit.target: The following steps create the B2B API Apps using the API Apps blade.

trans-unit.source: Create the BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM) API Apps
trans-unit.target: Create the BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM) API Apps

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] A BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM) instance is required to create an AS2 connector and X12 or EDIFACT API App.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] A BizTalk Trading Partner Management (TPM) instance is required to create an AS2 connector and X12 or EDIFACT API App.

trans-unit.source: When you create the TPM API App, you are creating the TPM Instance.
trans-unit.target: When you create the TPM API App, you are creating the TPM Instance.

trans-unit.source: The following steps create the TPM instance:
trans-unit.target: The following steps create the TPM instance:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal Startboard (the Home page), select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal Startboard (the Home page), select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: **API Apps** lists all the existing API Apps and connectors.
trans-unit.target: **API Apps** lists all the existing API Apps and connectors.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Search** for the specific B2B API Apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Search** for the specific B2B API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select **BizTalk Trading Partner Management**.
trans-unit.target: Select **BizTalk Trading Partner Management**.

trans-unit.source: In the new blade, select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the new blade, select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property | Description
trans-unit.target: Property | Description

trans-unit.source: Name | Enter any name for the TPM instance.
trans-unit.target: Name | Enter any name for the TPM instance.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can name it *AccountsPayableTPM*.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can name it *AccountsPayableTPM*.

trans-unit.source: Package Settings | Enter the ADO.NET **Database Connection String** to the Azure SQL Database you created.
trans-unit.target: Package Settings | Enter the ADO.NET **Database Connection String** to the Azure SQL Database you created.

trans-unit.source: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.
trans-unit.target: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string.

trans-unit.source: App Service Plan | Lists your payment plan.
trans-unit.target: App Service Plan | Lists your payment plan.

trans-unit.source: You can change it if you need more or less resources.
trans-unit.target: You can change it if you need more or less resources.

trans-unit.source: Pricing Tier | Read-only property that lists the pricing category within your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Pricing Tier | Read-only property that lists the pricing category within your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Resource Group | Create a new one or use an existing group.
trans-unit.target: Resource Group | Create a new one or use an existing group.

trans-unit.source: All API Apps and connectors for your Logic Apps, Web Apps, and Mobile Apps must be in the same Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: All API Apps and connectors for your Logic Apps, Web Apps, and Mobile Apps must be in the same Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: [Using resource groups](../resource-group-overview.md) explains this property.
trans-unit.target: [Using resource groups](../resource-group-overview.md) explains this property.

trans-unit.source: Subscription | Read-only property that lists your current subscription.
trans-unit.target: Subscription | Read-only property that lists your current subscription.

trans-unit.source: Location | The Geographic location that hosts your Azure service.
trans-unit.target: Location | The Geographic location that hosts your Azure service.

trans-unit.source: Add to Startboard | Select this to add the B2B API App to your Starboard (the home page).
trans-unit.target: Add to Startboard | Select this to add the B2B API App to your Starboard (the home page).

trans-unit.source: Select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: After the TPM API APP (TPM Instance) is created, you can then create the AS2 connector and/or the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps.
trans-unit.target: After the TPM API APP (TPM Instance) is created, you can then create the AS2 connector and/or the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Create the AS2 connector
trans-unit.target: Create the AS2 connector

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal Startboard (the Home page), select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal Startboard (the Home page), select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: **API Apps** lists all the existing API Apps and connectors.
trans-unit.target: **API Apps** lists all the existing API Apps and connectors.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Search** for the specific B2B API Apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Search** for the specific B2B API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select **AS2 Connector**.
trans-unit.target: Select **AS2 Connector**.

trans-unit.source: In the new blade, select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the new blade, select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property | Description
trans-unit.target: Property | Description

trans-unit.source: Name | Enter any name for the AS2 connector.
trans-unit.target: Name | Enter any name for the AS2 connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can name it *AS2Connector*.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can name it *AS2Connector*.

trans-unit.source: Package Settings | Enter the settings specific to that API App, like the TPM Instance name.
trans-unit.target: Package Settings | Enter the settings specific to that API App, like the TPM Instance name.

trans-unit.source: See [Add AS2 Package Settings](#AddAS2Conn) in this topic for the specific properties.
trans-unit.target: See [Add AS2 Package Settings](#AddAS2Conn) in this topic for the specific properties.

trans-unit.source: App Service Plan | Lists your payment plan.
trans-unit.target: App Service Plan | Lists your payment plan.

trans-unit.source: You can change it if you need more or less resources.
trans-unit.target: You can change it if you need more or less resources.

trans-unit.source: Pricing Tier | Read-only property that lists the pricing category within your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Pricing Tier | Read-only property that lists the pricing category within your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Resource Group | Create a new one or use an existing group.
trans-unit.target: Resource Group | Create a new one or use an existing group.

trans-unit.source: [Using resource groups](../resource-group-overview.md) explains this property.
trans-unit.target: [Using resource groups](../resource-group-overview.md) explains this property.

trans-unit.source: Subscription | Read-only property that lists your current subscription.
trans-unit.target: Subscription | Read-only property that lists your current subscription.

trans-unit.source: Location | The Geographic location that hosts your Azure service.
trans-unit.target: Location | The Geographic location that hosts your Azure service.

trans-unit.source: Add to Startboard | Select this to add the B2B API App to your Starboard (the home page).
trans-unit.target: Add to Startboard | Select this to add the B2B API App to your Starboard (the home page).

trans-unit.source: AS2 connector Package Settings
trans-unit.target: AS2 connector Package Settings

trans-unit.source: Property | Description
trans-unit.target: Property | Description

trans-unit.source: Database Connection String | Enter the ADO.NET connection string to the Azure SQL Database you created.
trans-unit.target: Database Connection String | Enter the ADO.NET connection string to the Azure SQL Database you created.

trans-unit.source: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.
trans-unit.target: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string before you paste.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string before you paste.

trans-unit.source: Enable Archiving for incoming messages | Optional.
trans-unit.target: Enable Archiving for incoming messages | Optional.

trans-unit.source: Enable this property to store the message properties of an incoming AS2 message received from a partner.
trans-unit.target: Enable this property to store the message properties of an incoming AS2 message received from a partner.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob Storage Connection String | Enter the connection string to the Azure Blob Storage container you created.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob Storage Connection String | Enter the connection string to the Azure Blob Storage container you created.

trans-unit.source: When Archiving is enabled, the encoded and decoded messages are stored in this Storage container.
trans-unit.target: When Archiving is enabled, the encoded and decoded messages are stored in this Storage container.

trans-unit.source: TPM Instance Name | Enter the name of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management** API App you previously created.
trans-unit.target: TPM Instance Name | Enter the name of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management** API App you previously created.

trans-unit.source: When you create the AS2 connector, this connector executes only the AS2 agreements within this specific TPM instance.
trans-unit.target: When you create the AS2 connector, this connector executes only the AS2 agreements within this specific TPM instance.

trans-unit.source: Select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Create the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps
trans-unit.target: Create the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal Startboard (the Home page), select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal Startboard (the Home page), select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: **API Apps** lists all the existing API Apps and connectors.
trans-unit.target: **API Apps** lists all the existing API Apps and connectors.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Search** for the specific B2B API Apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Search** for the specific B2B API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select **BizTalk X12** or **BizTalk EDIFACT**.
trans-unit.target: Select **BizTalk X12** or **BizTalk EDIFACT**.

trans-unit.source: In the new blade, select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the new blade, select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property | Description
trans-unit.target: Property | Description

trans-unit.source: Name | Enter any name for the B2B API App.
trans-unit.target: Name | Enter any name for the B2B API App.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can name it *EDI850APIApp*.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can name it *EDI850APIApp*.

trans-unit.source: Package Settings | Enter the settings specific to that API App, like the TPM Instance name.
trans-unit.target: Package Settings | Enter the settings specific to that API App, like the TPM Instance name.

trans-unit.source: See [X12 or EDIFACT Package Settings](#AddX12) in this topic for the specific properties.
trans-unit.target: See [X12 or EDIFACT Package Settings](#AddX12) in this topic for the specific properties.

trans-unit.source: App Service Plan | Lists your payment plan.
trans-unit.target: App Service Plan | Lists your payment plan.

trans-unit.source: You can change it if you need more or less resources.
trans-unit.target: You can change it if you need more or less resources.

trans-unit.source: Pricing Tier | Read-only property that lists the pricing category within your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Pricing Tier | Read-only property that lists the pricing category within your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Resource Group | Create a new one or use an existing group.
trans-unit.target: Resource Group | Create a new one or use an existing group.

trans-unit.source: [Using resource groups](../resource-group-overview.md) explains this property.
trans-unit.target: [Using resource groups](../resource-group-overview.md) explains this property.

trans-unit.source: Subscription | Read-only property that lists your current subscription.
trans-unit.target: Subscription | Read-only property that lists your current subscription.

trans-unit.source: Location | The Geographic location that hosts your Azure service.
trans-unit.target: Location | The Geographic location that hosts your Azure service.

trans-unit.source: Add to Startboard | Select this to add the B2B API App to your Starboard (the home page).
trans-unit.target: Add to Startboard | Select this to add the B2B API App to your Starboard (the home page).

trans-unit.source: X12 and EDIFACT API Apps Package Settings
trans-unit.target: X12 and EDIFACT API Apps Package Settings

trans-unit.source: Property | Description
trans-unit.target: Property | Description

trans-unit.source: Database Connection String | Enter the ADO.NET connection string to the Azure SQL Database you created.
trans-unit.target: Database Connection String | Enter the ADO.NET connection string to the Azure SQL Database you created.

trans-unit.source: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.
trans-unit.target: When you copy the connection string, the password is not added to the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string before you paste.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to enter the password in the connection string before you paste.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Namespace | Enter the Service Bus namespace you created.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Namespace | Enter the Service Bus namespace you created.

trans-unit.source: Required only when batching is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Required only when batching is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Namespace Shared Access Key name | Enter the Service Bus namespace Access Key you created.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Namespace Shared Access Key name | Enter the Service Bus namespace Access Key you created.

trans-unit.source: Required only when batching is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Required only when batching is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Namespace Shared Access Key value | Enter the Service Bus namespace Access Key value you created.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Namespace Shared Access Key value | Enter the Service Bus namespace Access Key value you created.

trans-unit.source: Required only when batching is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Required only when batching is enabled.

trans-unit.source: TPM Instance Name | Enter the name of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management** API App you previously created.
trans-unit.target: TPM Instance Name | Enter the name of the **BizTalk Trading Partner Management** API App you previously created.

trans-unit.source: When you create the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps, this API App executes only the X12/EDFIACT agreements within this specific TPM instance.
trans-unit.target: When you create the X12 or EDIFACT API Apps, this API App executes only the X12/EDFIACT agreements within this specific TPM instance.

trans-unit.source: Select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Add your partners, agreements, certificates, and schemas
trans-unit.target: Add your partners, agreements, certificates, and schemas

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, open your TPM API App.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, open your TPM API App.

trans-unit.source: In the **Components** section, add your Partners, Agreements, Certificates, and Schemas.
trans-unit.target: In the **Components** section, add your Partners, Agreements, Certificates, and Schemas.

trans-unit.source: You can also add agreements to your AS2 connectors, X12 API Apps, and EDIFACT API Apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also add agreements to your AS2 connectors, X12 API Apps, and EDIFACT API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Monitor your API Apps
trans-unit.target: Monitor your API Apps

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, open your TPM API App.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, open your TPM API App.

trans-unit.source: In the **Operations** section, you can view different management operations.
trans-unit.target: In the **Operations** section, you can view different management operations.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: View Informational and Error events
trans-unit.target: View Informational and Error events

trans-unit.source: View memory usage and thread count of the worker process (w3wp)
trans-unit.target: View memory usage and thread count of the worker process (w3wp)

trans-unit.source: View the Application and web server logs
trans-unit.target: View the Application and web server logs

trans-unit.source: More at [Monitor your Logic Apps](app-service-logic-monitor-your-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: More at [Monitor your Logic Apps](app-service-logic-monitor-your-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Add the API Apps to your application
trans-unit.target: Add the API Apps to your application

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure App Service exposes different application types that can use these B2B API Apps.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure App Service exposes different application types that can use these B2B API Apps.

trans-unit.source: You can create a new or add your existing B2B API Apps to Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or a Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new or add your existing B2B API Apps to Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or a Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Within your App, simply selecting the B2B API Apps from the Gallery automatically adds it to your App.
trans-unit.target: Within your App, simply selecting the B2B API Apps from the Gallery automatically adds it to your App.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To add connectors and API Apps you previously created, create the Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or Web Apps in the same Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] To add connectors and API Apps you previously created, create the Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or Web Apps in the same Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: The following steps add the B2B API Apps to Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or Web Apps:
trans-unit.target: The following steps add the B2B API Apps to Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or Web Apps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal Startboard (home page), go to the **Marketplace**, and search for your Logic, Mobile, or Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal Startboard (home page), go to the **Marketplace**, and search for your Logic, Mobile, or Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a new App, search for Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a new App, search for Logic Apps, Mobile Apps, or Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select the App and in the new blade, select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select the App and in the new blade, select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: [Create a Logic App](app-service-logic-create-a-logic-app.md) lists the steps.
trans-unit.target: [Create a Logic App](app-service-logic-create-a-logic-app.md) lists the steps.

trans-unit.source: Open your App and select **Triggers and Actions**.
trans-unit.target: Open your App and select **Triggers and Actions**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Gallery**, select the B2B API App, which automatically adds it to your App.
trans-unit.target: From the **Gallery**, select the B2B API App, which automatically adds it to your App.

trans-unit.source: You can also create a new B2B API App.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a new B2B API App.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The AS2 connector and X12, EDIFACT API Apps require a TPM Instance.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The AS2 connector and X12, EDIFACT API Apps require a TPM Instance.

trans-unit.source: So if you're creating new B2B API Apps, create the TPM API App first, and then create the AS2 connector, X12 API App, or EDIFACT API App.
trans-unit.target: So if you're creating new B2B API Apps, create the TPM API App first, and then create the AS2 connector, X12 API App, or EDIFACT API App.

trans-unit.source: Select **OK** to save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Select **OK** to save your changes.
